alert.note: Alert for Dewey (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 4:30PM CDT until August 09 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Oklahoma and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Oklahoma, Blaine and Dewey. In western Oklahoma, Custer. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 429 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Localized rainfall amounts between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Weatherford, Thomas, Hydro, Custer City, Bridgeport, Greenfield and Fay. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
